video:video.video:title: Silverlight Geek - An interview with Jesse Liberty
video:video.video:description: Jesse Liberty is the official Silverlight Geek. What does that mean? Why should you care? And what does he think about Expression Blend? In this interview Jesse attempts to answer those stories&#8230;

Deployment in .NET 4 Beta 1
video:video.video:description: Jossef Goldberg explains how the deployment of your client applications will be easier in .NET 4. The new Client Profile and improved Visual Studio feature integration are shown off as we walk&#8230;

video:video.video:title: XAML in .NET 4
video:video.video:description:
This isn't your Grandpa's XAML!
XAML in .NET 4 is much more than just a Reader and Writer and also is now being consumed by many technologies including Silverlight, WCF, WF and of course WPF. Rob&#8230;

video:video.video:title: An overview of WPF 4 Beta 1
video:video.video:description: Jaime Rodriguez sat down with Ian Ellison-Taylor and Kevin Gjerstad to talk about WPF 4 Beta 1. The topics they cover include graphics and text improvements, Windows 7 integration, how WPF relates&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Sensor and Location .NET Library for Windows 7

video:video.video:description: This is a personal invite from James Senior to attend the Live Services Hackathon in San Francisco on May 27, 2009. Bring your code and work with the Live Services engineers to add Instant&#8230;

video:video.video:title: WPF Design Surface Improvements in Visual Studio 2010
video:video.video:description: After a short break for the show, Karl Shifflett is here to welcome us back with wide open arms, a Hawaiian shirt and a demonstration of the new features in Visual Studio 2010 for WPF development.&#8230;

video:video.video:title: RichText Editor in Silverlight and more from DevExpress
video:video.video:description: Another opportunity I had at MIX09 was to talk to the guys from DevExpress about the controls they are working on. Azret Botash explains how they are going after the features that people say can't be&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Silverlight Spy - Visual Debugging Silverlight Applications
video:video.video:description: Koen Zwikstra has created a very useful tool for Silverlight application development called SilverlightSpy. Load the tool, point it to a web page with a Silverlight application and the dissection&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Fireworks to XAML Panel

video:video.video:title: A look into the ComponentOne Studio for Silverlight
video:video.video:description: During MIX09 I had the opportunity to sit down with the guys from ComponentOne and take a look at the controls available in their new Studio for Silverlight 2009 release. Along with a full-featured&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Pete Brown, Silverlight Wizard in Action
video:video.video:description: Pete Brown brought along some fun toys to MIX09 written in the Silverlight 3 Beta which he demonstrates in this video. The first toy is a Commodore64 emulator running print commands and the Dr. Who&#8230;

video:video.video:title: WPFFX running in the Silverlight 3 Beta
video:video.video:description: Jaime Rodriguez came back from MIX09 and thought &quot;Hey, I bet my WPFFX library could run in the new Silverlight 3 beta&quot;. So he added a few #ifdefs, compiled and waa-laa! The WPFFX library &#8230;

video:video.video:title: Colaab, review and collaborate in Silverlight
video:video.video:description: Colaab is a Silverlight-based review and collaborative environment packed with features. What is a collaborative environment? Its one of those things you need, but don't quite have a name for. &#8230;

video:video.video:title: ASP.NET MVC 1 with Phil Haack
video:video.video:description: ASP.NET MVC 1.0 has been released today at MIX09! Phil Haack stopped by the studio last week to explain what makes this version 1 of the MVC Framework for ASP.NET and spends a little time explaining&#8230;

video:video.video:title: First Look at Expression Blend 3
video:video.video:description: Unni Ravindranathan takes on a tour of the new Expression Blend 3 Preview released at MIX09. Not only has Blend been updated to support Silverlight 3, but many new features have been added including&#8230;

video:video.video:title: SilverSprite - XNA Games in Silverlight
video:video.video:description: Bill Reiss is building games in Silverlight, but he also likes to build games in XNA. The obvious move then is to create a library that allows you to run XNA games within Silverlight. And no code&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Silverlight is Ready for Business
Live Services Explained
video:video.video:description: What's the difference between Live Services, Live Framework and Live Mesh? James Senior has arrived to explain how you can use Live Services in your applications today and how you can plan future &#8230;

video:video.video:title: Anatomy of a Silverlight Game
video:video.video:description: Nikola Mihaylov has written a game in Silverlight called Shock. This is not just a &quot;fun project over the weekend&quot; game. There are multiple game modes, music playlists, leaderboards,&#8230;

video:video.video:title: MIX09 10k Winners
video:video.video:description:
The question was simple - &quot;What can you build with Silverlight or WPF in 10k?&quot;
Many attempted to dazzle the judges and the community, but only few could win and only one would be granted&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Prism v2 - Composite Application Guidance for WPF and Silverlight
video:video.video:description: Composite Application Guidance, affectionately known as Prism, version 2 has been released. Prism provides guidance and code that can help you build modular applications that can adapt to constant&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Descry, data and information visualization
video:video.video:description: The MIX Online team has released their latest issue covering the topic of data and information visualization. Along with two articles on building infographics and future thinking around&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Kaxaml, a lightweight XAML editor
video:video.video:description: Robby Ingebretsen came by to explain what Kaxaml is and how it can be useful to you when developing XAML-based applications. Not only does he introduce the tool, but he also touches on some of the&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Presidential Inauguration in Silverlight and Moonlight
video:video.video:description: This week during the Presidential Inauguration, Silverlight was used by both CBS and the official Presidential Inauguration Committee site to stream the event live. Steven Woodward and Ben Waggoner&#8230;

video:video.video:title: MVVM, a WPF UI Design Pattern
video:video.video:description: What is MVVM and why do people keep talking about it? Karl Shifflett explains why its buzz worthy and why you should consider it as a design pattern for your application development. Karl discusses&#8230;

video:video.video:title: PhotoSuru, a WPF-based photo experience
video:video.video:description: PhotoSuru is a new photo viewing sample from the WPF team. The sample provides a unique way to browse a collection of photos, taking advantage of WPF features such as Pixel Shaders, Adaptive Layout&#8230;

video:video.video:title: XAML Guidelines, Part 2
XAML Guidelines, Part 1
Oxite, an ASP.NET MVC based blog
video:video.video:description:
When ASP.NET MVC hit like Preview 3 or 4, quite a few of us were saying &quot;We should get together and build new blog software based on MVC, it would be so fun!&quot;.
Well as good ideas go&#8230;

video:video.video:title: XAML Power Toys - Instant Form Generation
Smart Search and Replace with Aggiorno
video:video.video:description: Gilbert Corrales quickly fixes invalid and unfriendly HTML and CSS using Aggiorno, a code refactoring tool that runs as a plug-in for Visual Studio. I really like the Smart Search and Replace&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Shazzam - A Tool for Creating WPF Pixel Shader Effects
video:video.video:description: Walt Ritscher walks us through building a custom WPF Pixel Shader Effect using Shazzam, his latest creation. Along the lines of other useful tools mentioned, Kaxaml and LINQPad, Shazzam is free to&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Dynamic 3D Charts with Telerik
video:video.video:description: Vladimir Milev and Todd Anglin show us the new Charting and Gauge controls from Telerik. The Charts are very flexible and run in 2D and 3D mode, you can even use your own custom models for the 3D&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Smooth Scrolling Datagrids with Xceed
video:video.video:description: Pascal Bourque demonstrates a prototype of the next Datagrid from Xceed. They've improved the datagrid by paying attention to perceived response times and adding some modern functionality like&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Exploring Time and Space with Infragistics
video:video.video:description:
Jason Beres takes us on a journey through time and space using the new Timeline, Map and Zoombar controls from Infragistics.
The Timeline and Zoombar make an interesting pair when combined with&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Surface beats with Vectorform
video:video.video:description: SurfaceDJ from Vectorform was one of my favorite applications shown at PDC. Not only does it involve Multi-touch, Surface and music; but it is an example of a new form of collaborative application. &#8230;

video:video.video:title: IdentityMine's multitude of Multi-touch apps

video:video.video:title: UT3 Bots for .NET

video:video.video:title: Conchango and the Tesco project

video:video.video:title: QuakeLight Preview
video:video.video:description: In this video, I'm running a preview version of QuakeLight a Silverlight-based port of Quake. Its very impressive to see an old-school classic game come to life in Silverlight 2. Stunned, along with&#8230;

video:video.video:title: WPF Pixel Shader Parts
video:video.video:description:
Nikola Mihaylov came by the studio to explain what a WPF Pixel Shader really is and the code involved and making one. He has a great post on his blog explaining how to
get started with Pixel&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Project Rosetta
video:video.video:description: Project Rosetta is a site dedicated to helping designers and developers build applications in Silverlight while taking advantage of skills they already know. In this interview, I caught up with Rick&#8230;

video:video.video:description: Originally noticed as &quot;a beautiful user experience in an enterprise application&quot;, Lawson Smart Office provides a distinctive personalized experience for someone managing their&#8230;

video:video.video:title: NBCOlympics.com Update
video:video.video:description:
Eric Schmidt drops by to tell stories about the NBCOlympics.com site launch and answer a few questions from the viewers.
Why is it US Only? Where is the FullScreen mode? How does the streaming&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Building NBCOlympics.com with Silverlight
video:video.video:description: NBCOlympics.com is one of the most ambitious projects on the web and one of the largest Silverlight applications today. Eric Schmidt takes us on a technical tour of how the site works and how it was&#8230;

video:video.video:title: MVC Preview 4 with Phil Haack
video:video.video:description: Phil Haack, one of the driving forces behind ASP.NET MVC, provides the lowdown on what MVC is, what's new in Preview 4 and how you can help shape the next version. He also takes a call from his wife,&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Hello World
video:video.video:description: This is the beginning of a new show on Channel 9 focused on the world of UI technologies available from Microsoft. This includes some of your favorites like WPF, Silverlight, ASP.NET, Expression, IE8&#8230;
